Posts.Title: Reconctructive surgery - a couple of questions for my new breast friends?

Posts.Content: I was under the impression you were supposed to talk to the plastic surgeon first if there was a possibility of having to do a reconstruction and that he would confer with the surgeon before the operation? I want to make sure my surgeon is doing a skin saving mastectomy so that when you have the expanders put in it does not take so long as you already have a bit more skin to work with. Maybe it really does not make much of a difference and it sounds like he was pretty sure he could do the lumpectomy instead anyway. These are questions I wanted to ask. Maybe you could call him up and ask really quickly?
Posts.Title: wow, surgery tomarrow!!!

Ooops, sorry! As if there isn't enough to learn about

Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed 10-1-06

Posts.Content: Oh Jule, I can't believe you are going in that quickly!!! That's kind of like being pregnant and all of a sudden labor starts and you're thinking "wait, maybe just another day or two!" I have been trying to get my own doctor on the phone all day. I have questions I want to ask before I meet with the plastic surgeon on Thursday and it sounds like his schedule is full until after Thanksgiving?!!!
Posts.Title: wow, surgery tomarrow!!!

Posts.Content: I just wish someone would step up and just tell me what to do - that would be a whole lot easier! But I am sure we will make it thru - way too much yet in this life to do. Perhaps this is just God's way of saying slow down and smell the roses.
Posts.Title: wow, surgery tomarrow!!!

Posts.Content: Holy cow! So what did he say?!!!!!
Posts.Title: wow, surgery tomarrow!!!

Posts.Content: That's what we needed - the calm voice of experience!! Do you know Lori, if Jules asks, will they give her something to numb the pain or maybe a valium or something before they do the sentinel node biopsy?
Posts.Title: wow, surgery tomarrow!!!

Posts.Content: I will bring along some lucky Las Vegas dice, pink ones of course - winner 777s! That's you Jule!
Posts.Title: wow, surgery tomarrow!!!

Posts.Content:
Hi Jule,
SO glad to hear you are feeling better than expected. That is wonderful! But take it easy - don't be pulling any stitches out!
I am still in never never land. Finally got in to see the plastic surgeon assigned to me by my HMO. He was literally over 70 years old (got his med school degree in 1964), he and his nurses put me in a dentist like looking chair then stood totally across the room from me (I felt like I was a spy being interrogated by the gestapo - soooo, you vant a new brrreast...), he did not believe in immediate reconstruction, he did not believe in silicone implants, then he treated me like a total idiot when I mentioned the alloderm reconstruction method being used in New York (I brought an article and he would not even look at it). When I asked to see his before and after photos (remember this is a surgeon who has been around more than 40 years) he showed me a book that had about
 10 before and afters in it and they all except one looked like something from a boob horror show. 
Anyway, long story short (oops too late for that!), now I can get a referral to another surgeon. But I truly think I am going to try to get a consult with these doctors in New York. I have been on another web site and the women there all seem to love them and rave about
 the results and the fact that it is a one operation reconstruction. I just have to find out if they can fit me in soon to do the surgery and if my insurance will cover any of it at all. What a life huh? 
It must be such a relief to have the surgery part over with! Do you know if you have to have chemo in addition to your surgery yet? Did you get your path results back?

AgeInfo.Phrase: <Z> He was literally over 70 years old  got his med

Posts.Title: wow, surgery tomarrow!!!
wow, surgery tomarrow!!!

Posts.Content:
I am so happy things worked out so well for you Jule. Not even a depression is awesome! And of course no lymph node involvement is the best.
If I was doing a lumpectomy I would probably be fine, but there seems to be absolutely no way to do a mastectomy with any kind of immediate reconstruction locally as all the plastic surgeons who do immediate reconstruction are busy for at least a month or more! :( So I am going to make reservations this morning and hope that some sort of miracle occurs where they either approve my insurance for the out of state docs (doubtful) or that somehow they find one locally that can do the procedure I want who gets a cancellation! Have a great day at work.
Posts.Title: wow, surgery tomarrow!!!

Posts.Content: Hi Jule,
Posts.Title: wow, surgery tomarrow!!!

Posts.Content:
Weight off your chest? Is that a little lumpectomy joke? :) I am so happy for you Jule, and am definitely looking forward to being that far along myself! Now all you need is a nice clean node biopsy and you will be totally on your way. How are you feeling?
Had my appointment today with the plastic surgeon who concurred with my general surgeon that a mastectomy was the better option for me because I don't have enough breast tissue to make a lumpectomy worthwhile. This guy is definitely not doing my reconstruction - I did not feel he was listening to what I wanted at all. He only wanted to do what he wanted to do. He does not believe in immediate reconstruction and would only do it if forced to. Fortunately for me he does not do silicone implants, which means I can now be referred to another plastic surgeon and my insurance will still cover most of it - hopefully I will be able to use the one I wanted in the first place. I just want to get this part behind me, get the surgery done and start healing.
Posts.Title: day after and a little more with it

Posts.Content: I go to see the plastic surgeon today that is the only one used by my HMO. I am not confident that he is going to be able to do what I want as I have heard he does not do immediate reconstructions or silicone implants (I am probably not a candidate for using my own tissue as I am small). Also, Las Vegas is so understaffed with doctors I don't know if I will even be able to find someone if I decide to just go pay for this myself. (Figured I spent all these years working so many hours every week, I may as well spend something on me for a change and this would seem to be the time.)
Posts.Title: Best Cancer Surgery Hospitals and Reconstruction Using Alloderm

Posts.Content:
Okay, got some good news yesterday, my hormone tests came back ER 99% positive and HER2 o.5% negative. I am post menopausal - any thoughts about
 which hormone drugs are the best with the least amount of side effects? And what 
 the side effects? No one has told me anything about
 that yet.
Posts.Title: Reconctructive surgery - a couple of questions for my new breast friends?

Posts.Content:
From what I have been hearing today Lauri, you are right on about
 the pre-existing stuff. There is a lot to learn.
Posts.Title: Birad 4 - wondering whether to make trip

Posts.Content:
Yes, I did check out the pictures - looks like you guys had a great time! So did anyone make a fortune at the track? LOL 
Have you been back to Vegas since then, MK? 
I will let you know what the insurance agent finds out. He seems to think I won't be able to change either. Doesn't seem to make sense, but we'll find out. I am just going to try and go on the trip and enjoy myself as much as possible. I am meeting my childhood friends - we get together every other year somewhere - in Asheville, NC to go watch the leaves and pretty much have a pajama party and pretend we are all 10 again. I haven't told any of them yet except my sister, but blabbermouth that she is, she will probably have told them all before I get there. Perhaps that will make it a bit easier anyway.
Posts.Title: Birad 4 - wondering whether to make trip

Posts.Content: I just got results today that my utlrasound and compressed mamogram indicate I am a Birad 4. (Just found lump on Wednesday by self exam - it is approximately 1 1/2 centimeters with irregular borders and hypervascularity. I am 53 years old and had never had a mamogram before this, stupid me!) I am supposed to make a trip Monday morning and be gone until Tuesday the 31st. My primary ob-gyn can't tell me how long it will take to get an appointment to do the biopsy, said it might be a week to 10 days, but on the other hand she might be able to get me in if there is a cancellation in a couple of days. Should I take this trip and tell her to try and schedule me for the 31st, or wait here to see if I can get in earlier?

AgeInfo.Phrase: <Z> <Z> <Z> I am 53 years old and had never

Posts.Title: Birad 4 - wondering whether to make trip

Posts.Content:
Thanks Mary K,
I am hoping also that because it is higher in cost for me and they are going to have to pay anyway as it is the same company, that they will allow me to upgrade and switch over, though my insurance agent does not seem think that will be the case. But if the results of the biopsy are positive, I am going to see if I can make arrangements to pay the referred doctor out of my own pocket if I can at all afford it. 
And I am going to go on my trip - I have advised my doctor to try and schedule me for the biopsy the day after I get back - hopefully she can. In the mean time I am going to do a lot of praying and I will certainly share my story, no doubt about
 that! It's most amazing to me that after all the horror stories people told me about
 mamograms, it was a piece of cake. Not even uncomfortable as far as I was concerned. 
Thanks for the advice on keeping reports. I have started a file (in a pink file folder!) I will let you know what happens. I have been a huge booster of the Sunshine Kids for a number of years. Never thought that I might need a support group myself though. Guess you never imagine it could happen to you. And I feel perfectly fine and as full of energy as ever. I am just going to try and keep myself as busy as possible until I learn one way or another what is going on. 
Are there any special diets or anything else that helps prevent/control cancer that I should be looking into?
Posts.Title: Birad 4 - wondering whether to make trip

Posts.Content:
Jule, do not forget to have someone post to us about
 how you are doing!
Posts.Title: wow, surgery tomarrow!!!

Posts.Content:
I will try and sign up for that later today. Right now I do have to go do some work. There is still all that surgery god knows what else to pay for!
I have been told too that because of my age (though I am 53) they will probably want to do chemo as well, though probably not radiation since I am going with a mastectomy. There is a chance I may not have to do chemo if I qualify to do an oncotype dx test (no lymph node involvement) and it shows that chemo really would not be a benefit. We'll see. I am not even thinking that far ahead yet!

Posts.Content: I have another question - if you have a mastectomy and you cannot get the reconstruction started until later - do you wear some sort of prosthesis in the meantime? Or are there special padded bras you can use temporarily?
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed 10-1-06

Posts.Content:
will settle for looking human at this point instead of like weird science! 
would love to chat though I have not used either of those? just tell me which one to set it up and I can do it! :) 
I also thought you would know your initial results right away - at least what the pathologists impression was about
 node involvement pending final verification of the path results. The way I understood it is they take out the nodes first and send them off for pathology while the surgeon completes the rest of the lumpectomy or mastectomy. that way they know if they should take out more nodes.
Posts.Title: wow, surgery tomarrow!!!

Posts.Content: Okay, just got the news yesterday that my biopsy was positive for invasive ductal carcinoma. I knew I was in trouble when the surgeon's office called me, as before they had said I should wait until tomorrow to call for my results. (That woman must hate her job!) My husband was away in the Utah mountains with no cell service and I pretty much wigged out for half an hour or so. I did manage to catch him at a meeting though and he hurried right back home. Longest four hours I ever spent in my life.
Posts.Title: Need some input please - biopsy came back positive

Posts.Content: Went and talked with the RN who is going to be my coach through all this. She's great and what a relief to have someone to talk to who understands exactly what I am feeling as she is an 11 year survivor. I am usually such a positive person that it is weird to be sitting there talking and just have tears rolling down my cheeks. But the talking really does help even when I don't like any of the answers I am hearing. I guess once I get a plan together this will be a bit easier - yes? (It's okay to lie to me and tell me yes!)
Posts.Title: Need some input please - biopsy came back positive

Posts.Content: Hi Jule! I am sure you are relieved to get that behind you! Sleep well and hopefully you can give us all the details tomorrow! Love and Hugs! Diane

Posts.Content:
Hi Jule!
Great news! Boy, I sure can't wait to get to where you are!! I know the rest of the steps are not easy, but getting over the surgery hurdle and getting clean nodes has to be the hardest part - I hope! 
Diane
Posts.Title: Chemo and radiation

Posts.Content:
Hi, Diann 53 from Vegas. Just found a lump and got compressed mamogram and sonogram which rated me Birads 4. about
 1 1/2 cm, hard with irregular outline and hypovascularity. Waiting for biopsy appointment to be scheduled (yesterday wouldn't have been soon enough for me - the hell is in the waiting) and scared to death, even though I know it may be nothing. But I have read through all the posts here from the beginning, and am amazed at the courage and humor I find. Praying that if I am diagnosed with bc I will have the grace of all the women here who have gone before.
